results.description:
• What we'll do
At the inaugural AWS Meetup The Hague we'll have two interesting talks and some beer and pizza.

Schedule:
18:00 doors open, pizza and drinks served
19:00 first talk
19:45 second talk

The first talk:

Speaker: Farley (OlinData)
Title: Migrating data from tapes into Amazon Glacier
Description: How much does your data backup solution cost you in both effort and cost? We're going to dig into what it took to migrate 280TB of data the Naturalis museum in Leiden had from tapes into Amazon Glacier. We will go over the planning, execution, monitoring, verification, and closing out of this project. We'll share our knowledge and lessons learned which you can use as a starting point to do your own data migration.

Speaker: Ionut Dragoi (ex-Amazon Web Services Managed Services)
Title: Unit-testing for Boto3, the AWS python library
Description: We all know that testing the code we write is very important.
This is because we want to make sure that the code is actually doing what it is supposed to.
When it comes to complex systems, made up of multiple services interacting with each other,
the first tests that comes to mind are the functional, integration tests, that make sure the whole system is working as expected using real input and output. But how about testing smaller individual pieces of code? How do we make sure they are operating properly? And how do you do it when those small pieces of code are interacting with network services, like external API calls? One answer for this is mocking these external requests and in this session we will find out how can we use Python's mock library to unit test a function using boto3 to make AWS API calls.
Also, we will see how these unit tests can be automated by integrating them in a pipeline.

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know
We'll have drinks and pizza, sponsored by SumoLogic
results.how_to_find_us: Go into the main entrance of the WTC building, take the escalators to the 20th floor in Tower E. We're the office in the corner.
results.name: amazonians

results.description:
• What we'll do
At our second AWS Meetup The Hague we'll shake things up and have a quiz and a talk. This is all accompanied by ome beer and pizza. The first talk:

Quizmaster: Jonah
Title: Cloud architecture (pub) quiz
Description: Are you planning on getting your AWS certification any time soon? Are you already certified and feel that you have what it takes to compete with your peers?
Then tonight is for you! Meetups usually only consist of a few talks and the opportunity to drink beer and eat pizza. This time we’re going to shake things up a little.
Instead of a regular talk, we are going to do a Cloud Architecture pubquiz! Over the course of an hour you will get your chance to shine!

The talk:

Speaker: Gérard de Vos
Title: "There is something about serverless"
Description: Serverless is not just a silly name, it promises a new way of computing where we truly use it as a utility and pay per byte and compute second and not for the VMs and VHDs we spin up. This talk covers some of the What and the How but most importantly the Why.
It's got slides used for managers, some for developers and if the demo gods are appeased a demo.

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!
results.how_to_find_us: Go into the main entrance of the WTC building, take the escalators to the 20th floor in Tower E. We're the office in the corner.
results.name: amazonians

results.description:
• What we'll do
This week we’ll change it up and do the following...

Some AWS Warstories
and
An Expert Panel

So first, we’ll kick it off with some Warstories to warm things up. Every great (or evil) engineer has some great stories that drove (or dragged) their career forward. Come listen in to how this engineer got and continues to keep things moving in his career.

Then, we’ll transition into an open-discussion expert panel. We’ll have at least one senior engineer with lots of in-the-ditch experience with AWS and the cloud on site and we’ll make this an open dialogue. Anyone curious about any topics, or want guidance or advice on how to do something can stand up and ask questions, and one of the experts in attendance will try to answer. Any other experts in attendance (we’re talking about YOU?) are welcome to come to the front, and/or stand up and offer their experience to the group as well.

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know
We'll have drinks and pizza.

results.description:
• What we'll do
At our AWS Meetup The Hague we'll have two interesting talks and some beer and pizza.

The first talk:
Speaker:
Marcello Evangelista (OlinData)

Title:
Cloud Security 101: The new paradigms of having your data floating above our heads.

Summary:
In this introductory talk, we will go through the technical standpoints and also how the cloud affects the old security model philosophically. The concepts that will be presented are cross-platform but the session will use AWS as an example.

The second talk:
Speaker: TBA
Title: Working on it, check back soon :)

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know
We'll have drinks and pizza.

results.name: AWS - The Hague Meetup

results.description:
• What we'll do
Since the summer holidays started for a lot of people, we're keeping the meetup this month relatively informal with a single presentation and group discussion. And of course don't forget the beer and pizza!

Speaker: Marcello Evangelista
Title: Multiple Account Setups — A discussion about best practices and past experiences.

in this targeted discussion we will cover the advantages and challenges of multiple account setups and how to deal with standard drift in such environments.
This will be an interactive discussion so be prepared to share your thoughts and experiences with us!

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know
We'll have drinks and pizza.
results.how_to_find_us: Go into the main entrance of the WTC building, take the escalators to the 20th floor in Tower E. We're the office in the corner.
results.name: AWS - The Hague

results.description:
• What we'll do
At our AWS Meetup The Hague we'll have two interesting talks and some beer and pizza, sponsored by our friends from Sentia this time!

The first talk:
Speaker: Serkan Capkan
Title: AWS Deployment Tools - Advantages, Disdvantages and a use case story.
Description: On this session, we'll talk about AWS Deployment tools such as CodePipeline, CodeCommit, CodeBuild, CodeDeploy. Although the motivation is to make it interactive, the plan is to walk through all this products one by one, discuss about features and at the end explain a use case we've implemented at a multi-account environment.

The second talk:
Speaker: Walter Heck
Title: 2FA in AWS
Description: 2FA should be the standard in this day and age, but unfortunately it's not. We'll walk through an overview of the AWS CLI, terraform and serverless and look at how they (don't) support 2FA out of the box but you can still use it.

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know
We'll have drinks and pizza.

results.name: amazonians

results.description:
• What we'll do
At our AWS Meetup The Hague we'll have two interesting talks and some beer and pizza.

The first talk:
Speaker: Choon Ming Goh (OlinData)
Title: Reducing your AWS bills using Cloud Custodian
Description: Often enough we spawn up new resources in AWS but we either neglect the fact our bills grow bigger as our environments evolve or we do not enforce the clean up of AWS resource often enough. We can take measures to reduce our bills by changing instance size etc but there are more ways to go about it. This talk focuses on how teams can leverage the use of cloud custodian policies in order to reduce an ever growing AWS bills.

The second talk:
Speaker: Leon Kortekaas en Johan Steenhoven (Nationale Nederlanden)
Title: The Cloud journey of Nationale Nederlanden
Description: In this talk Leon and Johan will tell the story about their cloud journey, and the lessons learnt. This talk will not only focus on the technical aspect of things, but also the human side of things.

• What to bring:
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know:
We'll have drinks and pizza.

• Schedule:
18:00 - Doors open
18:10 - Food arrives
19:00 - Building doors close (If you're locked out, call the phonenumber that we announce the day before)

results.description:
• What we'll do
At our AWS Meetup The Hague we'll have two interesting talks and some beer and pizza.

The first talk:
Speaker: Leon Degeling
Title: Improving your professional life with AWS buttons.
Description: This talk touches IOT, lambda and just about all AWS API’s.

The second talk:
Speaker: Wim Bonthuis
Title: Introduction to Kubernetes on AWS
Description: An introduction to Kubernetes on AWS. We'll look at Fargate, EKS and running K8s on EC2 and give you and overview of how these two technologies can work together

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know
We'll have drinks and pizza.

results.name: amazonians

results.description:
• What we'll do
At our AWS Meetup The Hague we'll have two interesting talks and some beer and pizza.

The first talk:
Speaker: Murat Lostar
Title: Securing and assuring the cloud in the post-GDPR (& PCI/DSS, ISO 27001) era.
Summary: How can we design, implement, assess, select, control and audit different cloud types and services in the post PCI/DSS, ISO 27001, GDPR world? How can we integrate our organisational and IT security efforts with our cloud? The Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM) is specifically designed to provide fundamental security principles to guide cloud vendors and to assist cloud customers in assessing the overall security risk of services. During this talk and discussion, you will gain basic understanding of CSA-CCM and its different usage styles to meet your specific needs.

Murat, a regular keynote speaker on cyber security, has been in information security industry for more than 20 years with an additional previous 10+ years on software development. Besides managing a UK and Turkey based security consultancy company Lostar.com, he has been the founding president of ISACA-Istanbul Chapter and currently leading Cloud Security Alliance Chapter in Turkey.

The second talk:
Speaker: Gérard de Vos
Title: "Shift Left Security", what the funk does that mean?
Summary: In the agile, lean, DevOps communities people talk about improving security by "shifting left". Patterns and tools are emerging, or re-emerging, that make security less of a pain in the development process while also making applications more secure. In this talk, and discussion maybe, we explore what that means and how we can do that.

Gérard is a systems engineer (or devops engineer) and architect who helps businesses deliver value by applying DevOps and Lean principles, Continuous Delivery, and Cloud technologies.
He knows that IT services can be delivered faster, with lower risk and lower costs by applying modern architectures, organizational structures and ways of working made popular through the DevOps movement.

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know
We'll have drinks and pizza.
